title: Complex Numbers — From Impossible Equation to Quantum Reality
topic_summary: How the 'impossible' equation x² + 1 = 0 led to complex numbers, revolutionized mathematics, powered modern technology, and became essential for quantum mechanics.
target_audience: General audience with interest in math, science, and technology history

scenes.title: The Impossible Equation
scenes.narration_summary: x² + 1 = 0 defied mathematicians for 2,000 years until the imaginary unit i = √−1 solved it
scenes.animations: Equation writing, number line with failed attempts, dramatic reveal of i = √−1

scenes.title: A New Dimension
scenes.narration_summary: Complex numbers a + bi add a perpendicular imaginary dimension to mathematics
scenes.animations: Real number line expands to 2D complex plane with grid and labeled axes

scenes.title: The Fundamental Theorem
scenes.narration_summary: Every polynomial has roots in complex numbers; math becomes a universal language
scenes.animations: Polynomial with complex roots on plane, universal language text

scenes.title: Real-World Applications
scenes.narration_summary: Complex numbers power modern technology: signals, optics, grids, planes, buildings
scenes.animations: Cinematic sequence of technology icons with dramatic final statement

scenes.title: Schrödinger's Wave Equation
scenes.narration_summary: 1926: Schrödinger's complex wave equation iħ ∂ψ/∂t = Ĥψ describes quantum electrons
scenes.animations: Classical orbit dissolves to wave, dramatic equation reveal

scenes.title: The Wave Function
scenes.narration_summary: Complex ψ wave function collapses to real probability |ψ|²; quantum mechanics requires complex numbers
scenes.animations: Complex wave components merge to probability density, final statement
